titles.en: THE BOOK OF BELIEF (Emān) AND DISBELIEF (KUFR)
Chapter 207 – The ones Protected from the afflictions
Chapter 207 – The ones Protected from the afflictions

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (11/386)
text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ وَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ وَ غَيْرِهِ عَنْ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ ضَنَائِنَ يَضَنُّ بِهِمْ عَنِ الْبَلَاءِ فَيُحْيِيهِمْ فِي عَافِيَةٍ وَ يَرْزُقُهُمْ فِي عَافِيَةٍ وَ يُمِيتُهُمْ فِي عَافِيَةٍ وَ يَبْعَثُهُمْ فِي عَافِيَةٍ وَ يُسْكِنُهُمُ الْجَنَّةَ فِي عَافِيَةٍ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad and Ali Bin Ibrahim, form his father, altogether from Ibn Mahboub and someone else, from Abu Hamza,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘For Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic there are ‘Protected ones’, the afflictions being Withheld from them. So He<sup>azwj</sup> Gives them life in good health, and Sustaining them in good health, and Causing them to die in good health, and Resurrecting them in good health, and Making them to dwell in the Paradise in good health’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad and Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father all from ibn Mahbub and others from abu Hamza from abu Ja’far (a.s.) who has said the following: “Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy, is protective of certain people against misfortunes. He gives them life in good health, provides them sustenance in good health, causes them to die in safety, will raise them on the Day of Judgment in good health and will admit them in paradise in good health.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (1/387)
text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ خَلَقَ خَلْقاً ضَنَّ بِهِمْ عَنِ الْبَلَاءِ خَلَقَهُمْ فِي عَافِيَةٍ وَ أَحْيَاهُمْ فِي عَافِيَةٍ وَ أَمَاتَهُمْ فِي عَافِيَةٍ وَ أَدْخَلَهُمُ الْجَنَّةَ فِي عَافِيَةٍ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Usman Bin Isa, from Is’haq Bin Ammar,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I heard him<sup>asws</sup> saying that Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Created a people, Protecting them from the afflictions. Creating them in good health, and Letting them to live in good health, and Causing them to die in good health, and Entering them into the Paradise in good health’.
en.sarwar: 2. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Khalid from ‘Uthman ibn ‘Isa from Ishaq ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “I heard abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) saying, ‘Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy, has created a creature that He is very acquisitively protective of. He has created them in peace and security, grants them life in peace and security, causes them to die in peace and security and will admit them in paradise in peace and security.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (11/387)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ جَمِيعاً عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ الْقَدَّاحِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ ضَنَائِنَ مِنْ خَلْقِهِ يَغْذُوهُمْ بِنِعْمَتِهِ وَ يَحْبُوهُمْ بِعَافِيَتِهِ وَ يُدْخِلُهُمُ الْجَنَّةَ بِرَحْمَتِهِ تَمُرُّ بِهِمُ الْبَلَايَا وَ الْفِتَنُ لَا تَضُرُّهُمْ شَيْئاً .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father and a number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, altogether from Ja’far Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Al Qaddah,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘For Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic there are ‘Protected ones’ from His<sup>azwj</sup> creatures, Providing them with His<sup>azwj</sup> Bounties, and Endowing them by His good health, and Entering them into the Paradise by His<sup>azwj</sup> Mercy, the affliction and the strife passes them but without harming them by anything’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father and A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad all from Ja’far ibn Muhammad from ibn al-Qaddah from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy, is very protective of certain people in His creatures. He feeds them in bounties, grants them life in peace and security, will admit them in paradise with favor and mercy and He causes the misfortunes and afflictions to pass them by without harming them at all.”
